A4.text: Catholicism is the largest religion in France.

A5.text: Islam is ranked the 2nd largest religion in France

A6.text: Approximately 45,000 Catholic church buildings and chapels are spread out among 36,500 cities, towns, and villages in France, but a majority are no longer regularly used for Mass.

A7.text: The Catholic Church had been the official state religion of France since the conversion to Christianity of Clovis I, leading to France being called 'the eldest daughter of the Church'.

A8.text: Approximately 10% of the population aged 18-59 in 2019-2020 followed Islam.

A10.text: The numbers of French Muslims and Muslims in France are exaggerated.
